{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3332088,"name":"Liam","username":"RadiOA","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/b5ac83/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-13T15:45:58.268Z","cooked":"

Hello,

I’m having another issue with sys-id. Last time the voltages weren’t recorded correctly, now I’m having trouble with the velocity and position being scaled correctly. One of them (I can’t remember which) appeared to be correct, and the other was giving me values that were really small, like it was a scaling factor issue.

I’ve tried to look at other people’s code, but I couldn’t make too much sense of the way people were scaling their values.

If I have time, I’ll test again at our next meeting to make sure it wasn’t a one time bug and I’ll confirm whether it was position or velocity that looked incorrect. We tried to characterize at competition, so a number of things could have been forgotten or done incorrectly. Any ideas on why either position or velocity may be wrong would be appreciated.

Here is my code: swerve-sysid/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/Drive.java at main · frc1164/swerve-sysid · GitHub

Thanks!
